definition: To separate or divide something into distinct parts or entities, often used when referring to physical objects, relationships, or concepts. It commonly denotes the action of creating a clear distinction or disconnection between two or more elements.

examples.german: Ich möchte mich von ihm trennen.
examples.english: I want to separate from him.

examples.german: Sie trennte die Eier vom Eigelb.
examples.english: She separated the egg whites from the yolks.

examples.german: Die Straße trennt die beiden Stadtteile voneinander.
examples.english: The road separates the two neighborhoods from each other.

examples.german: Er trennte sich von seinen alten Gewohnheiten.
examples.english: He broke away from his old habits.

examples.german: Die Firma trennte sich von einigen Mitarbeitern.
examples.english: The company laid off some employees.
